page.title: 19Sport in Cattistock
page.content: Tennis - two grass courts and pavilion on glebe land let to local farmer and sublet to Tennis Club. Club of 20 members meets weekly. Also a private hard court which can be hired. Football- field belongs to Hunt and is used for grazing and hay during summer. The Club has two teams playing in Saturday League and Sunday friendly fixtures. Cricket - sloping, tree-lined pitch with a new pavilion constructed by members of the Cricket Club, which plays regular summer fixtures. Playing Field - old school playing field owned by County Council, leased to Parish Council. New swings and seats provided by Police Training College at Chantmarle. Committee recently formed to administer field and pay for upkeep and equipment.
